intro: Clipteria, commonly known as the "clipped fern," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Araliaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas, particularly in Central and South America. The plants typically have compound leaves with a distinctive, often bipinnate structure, giving them a feathery appearance. Clipteria species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their attractive foliage. They prefer shady, moist environments and are relatively easy to care for in the right conditions.
